dublin_core.dcvalue: BACKGROUND Phase contrast microscopy is the recommended technique for urine sediment examination Bright field microscopy does not differentiate objects with slight changes in the refractive index and hence phase contrast is a superior alternative METHODS In this article we describe a novel method to improve contrast in bright field microscopy A strategically placed disc of specific dimensions enhances the diffraction of rays by Fresnel principle causing a shift in wavelength in the rays which are perceived as differences in contrast by the eye due to constructive and destructive interference RESULTS Epithelial cells red blood cells RBCs dysmorphic red blood cells casts bacteria and crystals are easily seen and differentiated by this technique CONCLUSIONS The images obtained are similar to those obtained by phase contrast microscopy
Improved contrast microscopy: modification of bright field for urine sediment visualisation.
